info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 14 at 5:06AM PST until November 14 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The western portion of Ventura County.
* WHEN...Until 1100 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 502 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 1.50 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Ventura, Camarillo, Ojai, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Rose Valley, Ventura Harbor, La Conchita, Rincon Point, Point Mugu State Park, Meiners Oaks, Highway 33 between Wheeler Springs and Rose Valley Road, Lake Casitas, El Rio, Solimar Beach, Seacliff, Reyes Peak, Silver Strand Beach and Topatopa Peak. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING
